body.p: The Anthropic Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables developers to build secure, two-way connections between their data sources and AI-powered tools.

You can configure a reference to an MCP configuration file in the
Preferences Plugins / Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Enterprise / Model Context Protocol page. AI Positron utilizes this file to load extra tools that can be called by the AI engine when using the chat modes or when invoking custom AI actions.

dlentry.dd: Selecting this option allows local MCP servers to run as external processes.Local MCP servers are run as processes from the current user account and have full access to the computer resources as all other processes run in the user account. Before enabling this option, you need to ensure that your configuration starts a secure MCP server and does not expose you to security risks.

dd.p:
A reference to a JSON file that configures MCP servers of three possible types:
Local process
HTTP SSE
HTTP Streamable

dlentry.dd: The configured timeout for attempts to connect to each server or retrieve content from it.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: Enabled by default, this option allows all defined chat modes to access the tools provided by the MCP servers during conversations.
Presents the status of each MCP server connection and the tools that have been retrieved from it.
